III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/09/23, youth was restrained when they attempted to run
away. Youth's shoulder was hurt as a result.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on February 17,
2023. Complainant reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
February 21, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth A said she was previously in a restraint with Staff 1, Staff 2,
and Staff 5 in the grassy area near Sherk house and the road.
Youth A and Youth B were attempting to run away, and Staff 5
followed her and placed her in a restraint however was not able to
hold her correctly, so Staff 1 took over. Youth A said Staff 1 had
her arms bend up over her head and was holding her. Youth A
said she told Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 5 she was in pain, and they
released her. Youth A said she saw Nurse after the restraint and
told him her shoulder hurt. Youth A said she did receive medical
attention the following day.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
February 21, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth B said she was trying to AWOL with Youth A on January 9,
2023. Youth B said Youth A was placed in a restraint by Staff 1
and Staff 5 however she was not able to see it due to it being so
dark outside. Youth B said Youth A told her that Staff 1 hurt her
arm during the restraint. Youth B said she was unsure if Youth A
was able to see any doctors for her arm after the restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
February 21, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Staff 1 said he received an assistance call and responded and
saw Staff 2 and Staff 5 restraining Youth A upon his arrival. Staff 1
said he was trying to keep Youth B from attacking Staff 2 and Staff
5. Staff 1 said Staff 2 asked him to switch with her, so he
transitioned and placed Youth A in a benevolent hold. Staff 1 said
2

during the restraint Youth A did not complain of any arm or
shoulder pain. Staff 1 said Youth A did complain being short of
breath due to her asthma, so he released her, and she was given
her inhaler. Staff 1 said he walked with Youth A back to her house
but then left to go back to his own house. Staff 1 said he did not
have concerns about the situation or how it was handled.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
February 21, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Staff 2 said she was the on-call supervisor on January 9, 2023.
Staff 2 said she received a call for assistance with Youth A and
Youth B. Staff 2 said when she arrived Staff 5 had Youth A in a
restraint outside of Sherk house. Staff 2 said Staff 5 was
struggling to hold Youth A because Youth A was being assaultive,
so Staff 2 assisted, and they placed Youth A in a two person hold.
Staff 2 said Youth B then became assaultive towards her and Staff
5, so another assistance call was made for more staff. Staff 2 said
Staff 1 arrived and was preventing Youth B from hitting Staff 2 and
Staff 5. Staff 2 said she asked Staff 1 to take over for her and Staff
5 while she dealt with Youth B. Staff 2 said Staff 1 took over the
restraint of Youth A and placed her in a benevolent hold while she
began to talk to Youth B and get her away from the restraint. Staff
2 said she did not have any concerns about the restraint with
Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth A complained of shoulder pain after
the restraint and staff looked at her arm and there was no
redness, swelling, or bruising so Youth A was given ice, ibuprofen,
and a medical slip was sent to the nurse for Youth A to be seen
the next day. Staff 2 said the next day Youth A was using her arm
without any concerns. Staff 2 said Youth A has not reported any
concerns or ongoing pain with her shoulder that she is aware of.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
February 27, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Staff 5 said she was working the evening Youth A was restrained
on January 9, 2023. Staff 5 said Youth A had recently been on a
safety plan for self-harming and suicidal ideations and during the
evening of January 9, 2023, was making statements about
jumping off her bed and “busting her head open”. Staff 5 said
Youth A had a phone call with her mentor that “did not go well” in
the evening of January 9, 2023. Staff 5 said she was completing
room checks on the youth and when she got to Youth A’s room,
she had two coats on and a backpack that was “full” wrapped in a
blanket. Staff 5 said she asked Youth A what she was doing and
to give her the backpack to which Youth A denied having the
backpack and refused to give Staff 5 anything. Staff 5 said she
immediately went to alert the other staff that she thought Youth A
3

might try to run away and while doing this Youth A ran out of the
house. Staff 5 said she followed behind Youth A concerned for her
safety due to her having unknown things in her backpack and
having been on a prior safety plan. Staff 5 said Youth A stopped
running and was talking with her at which time Staff 5 said she
took hold of Youth A’s backpack to try to remove that from her
possession. Staff 5 said Youth A pulled away from her in attempts
to keep the backpack and run so Staff 5 initiated a restraint. Staff
5 said Staff 2 and Staff 1 arrived to assist. Staff 5 said she and
Staff 1 transitioned into a two person hold and then Staff 1 took
over the hold and Staff 5 went to talk to Youth B who was also
outside attempting to run away. Staff 5 said the restraint was
under ten minutes in total and she did not have any concerns
about the hold or positioning of Staff 1. Staff 5 said once back in
the facility Youth A complained her shoulder was hurting. Staff 5
said she looked at Youth A’s shoulder and it was slightly red but
there was no swelling or bruising. Staff 5 said Youth A was given
ice and an ibuprofen. Staff 5 said about an hour later she looked
at Youth A’s shoulder again and it was completely normal. Staff 5
said she has worked many shifts with Youth A and she has not
heard her complain of any shoulder pain and has been using her
arm without issue.
Clinical Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility,
on February 21, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS
worker. Clinical Director said she was on call the night of January
9, 2023. Clinical Director said she is also Youth A’s mentor and
had been talking with Youth A in that capacity in the evening of
January 9, 2023, prior to her attempting to run away. Clinical
Director said Youth A was being very loud and acting hyper when
they were talking on the phone. Clinical Director said Youth A told
her she was rolling around and falling off her bed. Clinical Director
said Youth A did not disclose any self-harm behaviors during that
call however did make a statement about doing something that
would require Clinical Director to come into the facility to see her.
Clinical Director said they ended the call and later in the evening
she received another call from staff due to Youth A’s attempt to
AWOL. Clinical Director said she debriefed with Youth A and
Youth A reported she had set up a plan with Youth B to AWOL
and staff restrained her. Clinical Director said Youth A told her
Staff 1 “pulled” her arm and now her shoulder was hurting. Clinical
Director said she talked to the staff working and they reported they
looked at Youth A’s arm and it was not bruised, no redness, and
maybe slightly swollen. Clinical Director said nursing was
contacted to check Youth A’s arm and shoulder the following day.
Clinical Director said she saw Youth A on January 10, 2023, and
4

she reported her arm was sore. Clinical Director said she has
seen Youth A almost daily since then and Youth A has been using
her arm normally and has not reported any issues with her
shoulder or arm.
Documents Reviewed
• MiSACWIS Incident Report for Youth A’s restraint dated
January 9, 2023. The incident report is consistent with Staff
5’s interview.
• Youth A’s Health Care Visit Report from Eagle Village
dated January 10, 2023. The diagnosis noted no
discoloration or deformity and full range of motion with arm.
• Youth A’s safety plan dated December 25, 2022, ending
December 28, 2022. The safety plan was in place due to
Youth A’s self-harm behavior, self-harm ideation/desires,
suicidal ideations, and suicidal behaviors.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Youth Restraint. The
restraint with Youth A was justified and done per the Aegis model.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health
Description service policies and procedures addressing all of the
following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and
behavioral health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was in pain and was sent for nursing attention. On 1/28/23,
youth was taken to the ER and the following week, youth needed
to be scheduled for orthopedic and physical therapy
appointments. These were never scheduled. Youth is still
complaining of shoulder pain. Four requests have been made for
the ER follow-up appointment paperwork.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on February 17,
2023. Complainant reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
February 21, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Youth A said she was previously in a restraint with Staff 1, Staff 2,
and Staff 5. Youth A said her shoulder was hurt during the
restraint. Youth A said saw Nurse after the restraint and told him
5

her shoulder hurt. Youth A said Nurse told her that she may have
a pulled muscle since there was no bruising, redness, or swelling
and to take ibuprofen, put ice on it, and give it a few days to heal.
Youth A said she continued to have pain and told Staff 3, Staff 4,
and other staff that she was still hurting. Youth A said she went on
a visit with a prospective foster family, and they took her to the
emergency room. Youth A said she was also seen by her
pediatrician and told them about her arm pain. Youth A said she
continues to have pain in her arm.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on February
21, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Nurse said
he saw Youth A on January 10, 2023, the day after the restraint
and there was no bruising, no redness, and no swelling. Nurse
said Youth A came to see him again on January 24, 2023, and
told him she was still in pain. Nurse said Youth A was due for her
well child exam. He scheduled that appointment so she could
have her exam and address any issues with her arm. Nurse said
Youth A was taken to the emergency room while on a home visit
however he only got the emergency room summary which had
limited information on February 3, 2023. Nurse said Youth A was
scheduled and saw her primary care doctor on February 7, 2023.
Nurse said the primary care doctor did not have any concerns or
further referrals for Youth A’s arm at that time. Nurse said he then
requested the full record from the emergency room visit which he
received on February 10, 2023. Nurse said the emergency room
records did not indicate any additional referrals that they made for
follow up exams for Youth A’s shoulder. Nurse said common
practice for a youth seen at the hospital is if the doctor wants
further evaluation for the youth the hospital makes the referral,
and he receives a call from the place of the referral to schedule an
appointment. Nurse said there was no referral made for Youth A.
Nurse said he received a call from the foster care worker
requesting that Youth A be scheduled for an orthopedic exam and
physical therapy. Nurse said the orthopedic exam is scheduled for
February 22, 2023.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
February 21, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Staff 2 said she was the on-call supervisor on January 9, 2023
and was involved in the restraint with Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth
A complained of shoulder pain after the restraint and staff looked
at her arm and there was no redness, swelling, or bruising so
Youth A was given ice, ibuprofen, and a medical slip was sent to
the nurse for Youth A to be seen the next day. Staff 2 said the
next day Youth A was using her arm without any concerns. Staff 2
6

said Youth A has not reported any concerns or ongoing pain with
her shoulder that she is aware of.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
February 21, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Staff 3 said Youth A mentioned to her that her shoulder was
hurting the day before she had a well-child exam. Staff 3 said
Youth A had not said anything prior to that or since that time about
her shoulder. Staff 3 said Youth A uses her arm normally and she
has never noticed any issues or had any concern about Youth A’s
arm.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
February 21, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Staff 4 said Youth A has never reported to her that her shoulder
hurt. Staff 4 said she has not seen Youth A favor one arm over
another and is always very active and uses both arms normally.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
February 27, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Staff 5 said she was working the evening Youth A was restrained
on January 9, 2023. Staff 5 said after the restraint, Youth A
complained her shoulder was hurting. Staff 5 said she looked at
Youth A’s shoulder and it was slightly red but there was no
swelling or bruising. Staff 5 said Youth A was given ice and an
ibuprofen. Staff 5 said about an hour later she looked at Youth A’s
shoulder again and it was completely normal. Staff 5 said she has
worked many shifts with Youth A and she has not heard her
complain of any shoulder pain and has been using her arm
without issue.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
February 21, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Therapist said she at least sees Youth A weekly for individual
therapy and group therapy however it is common for her to see
her more than that due to Youth A asking to meet with her often.
Therapist said Youth A had reported her arm hurt the day after her
restraint and has not mentioned any concerns or pain with her
shoulder since that day. Therapist said she has not seen Youth A
favor that arm or not use it regularly.
Clinical Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility,
on February 21, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS
worker. Clinical Director said she was on call the night of January
9, 2023. Clinical Director said she received a call from staff due to
Youth A’s attempt to AWOL. Clinical Director said she debriefed
7

with Youth A and Youth A reported she had set up a plan with
Youth B to AWOL and staff restrained her. Clinical Director said
Youth A told her Staff 1 “pulled” her arm and now her shoulder
was hurting. Clinical Director said she talked to the staff working
and they reported they looked at Youth A’s arm and it was not
bruised, no redness, and maybe slightly swollen. Clinical Director
said nursing was contacted to check Youth A’s arm and shoulder
the following day. Clinical Director said she saw Youth A on
January 10, 2023, and she reported her arm was sore. Clinical
Director said she has seen Youth A almost daily since then and
Youth A has been using her arm normally and has not reported
any issues with her shoulder or arm.
Orthopedic Administrator was interviewed via telephone, on
March 15, 2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Orthopedic Administrator said she is aware of Youth A’s medical
chart. Orthopedic Administrator said she reviews all charts from
the emergency room that are “flagged” with orthopedic follow up.
Orthopedic Administrator said Youth A’s chart did not have
specific timeframe noted for the follow up to occur. Orthopedic
Administrator said she reached out to the foster parent to attempt
to schedule an appointment however foster parent never
responded. Orthopedic Administrator said Nurse called to set the
appointment up for Youth A. Orthopedic Administrator said there
were no concerns with the timeframe in which Youth A had her
orthopedic follow up appointment as Youth A did not have a
fracture or dislocation therefore it was not emergent.
Documents Reviewed
• Youth A’s Health Care Visit Report from Eagle Village
dated January 10, 2023. The diagnosis noted no
discoloration or deformity and full range of motion with arm.
• Email regarding Youth A’s orthopedic appointment. The
appointment was moved from February 22, 2023, to March
1, 2023, due to winter storm.
• Youth A’s well child exam documentation dated February 7,
2023. The well child exam reported the concerns that were
brought up by Youth A which did not include any issues or
pain to the shoulder or arm. The exam included a
musculoskeletal system and noted the
joints/bones/muscles had no deformities and normal
movement of extremities.
• Youth A’s Spectrum Hospital Emergency Room records
dated January 28, 2023. The hospital notes reported the x-
ray of Youth A’s right shoulder had no evidence of fracture.
The “ED Provider Note” stated “Would recommend follow-
8

up with orthopedics for further evaluation and probable
physical therapy for persistent symptoms”. There was no
required follow up date in the report. The physical exam
noted “examination right shoulder there is no swelling,
erythema, ecchymosis.” The hospital did not make any
direct referrals that are noted on the paperwork.
• Youth A’s Orthopedic follow up appointment notes from
Spectrum Health dated March 1, 2023. The notes indicate
“no numbness, not loss of motion, no focal weakness, no
tingling, no stiffness, no swelling, and no looseness”.
Additionally, the doctor noted “normal’ for flexion, rotation,
and shoulder strength. The plan for treatment is to offer
Youth A physical therapy and Tylenol, if pain persists then
refer for an MRI.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Health Services. The
medical follow up by the facility after the restraint, after Youth A
disclosed ongoing pain, and after the emergency room visit was
completed appropriately and timely.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
